`lazy-image` uses Intersection Observer API to detect if the element is inside the viewport and loads the image. 

Note: 
1. `Intersection Observer` polyfill is not included.
2. `placeholder` option expects the element to have an explicitly set width and hight.


Example:

```
<custom-element-demo>
  <template>
  <link rel="import" href="lazy-image.html">
  <!-- END-HIDDEN-SECTION: Add the visible part of the demo below. -->
  <lazy-image style="width: 400px; height: 300px;" src="demo/a.jpg" alt="Image alt text" fade placeholder="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></lazy-image>

  </template>
</custom-element-demo>
```
